duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide personal hygiene support to residents, including bathing, grooming, and dressing.
Administer medication and observe residents' self-administration, reporting any concerns.
Assist with repositioning residents in bed and escorting them within the community.
Take vital signs and report any abnormal changes in residents' health to a supervisor.
Communicate and report on residents' health, as well as provide emotional support and comfort to residents and their families.
Work alone and as part of a team, demonstrating strong emotional intelligence and dedication to the medical field.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent, minimum 2 years' experience in a hospital or clinical setting, Associates Degree or higher, focused on advancement into medical services, CPR/First Aid Certification desired (unless required by the State), Valid LPN certification or State/Local equivalent required
